glsa.title: IO::Socket::SSL: Certificate validation error
glsa.synopsis: An error in the hostname matching of IO::Socket::SSL might enable remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.

background.p: IO::Socket::SSL is a Perl class implementing an object oriented interface to SSL sockets.

description.p: The vendor reported that IO::Socket::SSL does not properly handle Common Name (CN) fields.

impact.p: A remote attacker might employ a specially crafted certificate to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks on SSL connections made using IO::Socket::SSL.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All IO::Socket::SSL users should upgrade to the latest version:
